name: 吳冠毅
objective: In the second semester, this course first introduces the physical behavior in a simple mixture system and describes the chemical equilibrium by physical variables and state function. Later, we will enter the microscopic world to see the fundamental particles with wave-like behavior. the quantum theory and methods are further introduced to the atomic/molecular orbitals and their energy levels. Finally, the molecular spectroscopy will be introduced.
schedule:
1. Simple mixture
2. Simple mixture
3. Chemical equilibrium
4. Chemical equilibrium
5. Quantum theory: introduction and principles
6. Quantum theory: introduction and principles
7. Quantum theory: techniques and applications
8. Quantum theory: techniques and applications
9. Midterm exam 
10. Atomic structure and spectra
11. Atomic structure and spectra
12. Molecular structure
13. Molecular structure 
14. Molecular symmetry
15. Molecular spectroscopy 1: rotational and vibrational spectra 
16. Molecular spectroscopy 1: rotational and vibrational spectra 
17. Molecular spectroscopy 2: electronic transitions
18. Final exam


The schedule is dependent on the actual progress of lesson.

Mid-term exam: 30
Final exam: 35
